bcl:form.bcl:lefttext: I/We, as the owner/owners of the property identified in the application (the "Property"), agree with Her Majesty the Queen in right of British Columbia (the "Province"), as represented by the minister responsible for the administration of the Land Tax Deferment Act, to defer property taxes on the Property as follows:
bcl:form.bcl:indent2: • to obtain the Parcel Identifier (PID) Number(s), registered owner information and legal description of the Property, or the details of the manufactured home that correspond with the Property and to endorse that information on this agreement with the intent that the endorsement will form part of this agreement, and in the case of the manufactured home, endorse the information on the financing statement,
• to obtain the value of any charges registered against the title on the Property from the registered chargeholders in order to verify the minimum equity requirements for tax deferment,

• to verify the information provided by accessing relevant records held by the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia, Home Owner Grant Administration, Land Title and Survey Authority, Personal Property Registry, Manufactured Home Registry, BC Assessment and other sources as required, and

• to register this agreement as a lien and charge against my/our interest in the Property in favour of the Province, noted on every Certificate of Title pertaining to the Property, or in the case of a manufactured home, to register a financing statement at the Personal Property Registry as a lien against my/our interest in the manufactured home in favour of the Province.
bcl:form.bcl:indent1: • I/We hereby agree to the following Terms and Conditions:
bcl:form.bcl:indent2: • I/We will repay all deferred taxes, interest, administration fees and charges accrued under this agreement that are outstanding at the date of termination of this agreement.
• I/We will notify the Province in the event of the death of an owner or when the Property is sold, transferred or otherwise disposed of.
• I/We will not assign any interest in this agreement or any right or benefits under this agreement.
• The Province will pay the property taxes to the collector of the jurisdiction in which the Property is located.
bcl:form.bcl:lefttext: Pursuant to the Land Tax Deferment Act, this agreement is approved.
Her Majesty the Queen in right of British Columbia, as represented by the minister responsible for the administration of the Land Tax Deferment Act.

bcl:form.bcl:lefttext: We, the undersigned owner/owners (the "Owner") of the property identified in the application (the "Property") and the undersigned spouse (the "Spouse") of the/an Owner, acknowledge that:
bcl:form.bcl:indent1: • the Owner made an agreement (the "Deferment Agreement") under the Land Tax Deferment Act (the "Act"), with Her Majesty the Queen in right of British Columbia (the "Province"), as represented by the minister responsible for the administration of the Act, permitting the Owner to defer property taxes on the Property;

• the Spouse is married to the Owner, .........................[name of applicable owner], or is living with that Owner in a marriage-like relationship, and has been living in that relationship for a continuous period of at least 2 years;
• the Spouse has read both the entire Deferment Agreement and the most recent statement of account setting out the amount outstanding under it;
• we have requested the minister responsible for the administration of the Act to enter into this Amending Agreement and wish to amend the Deferment Agreement to add the Spouse as a party to it.
bcl:form.bcl:lefttext: Therefore, we agree with the Province as follows:
bcl:form.bcl:indent1: • The Deferment Agreement is amended to add the Spouse as a signatory to it, by adding the name of the Spouse in one of the spaces provided for an owner's name.

• The Spouse agrees to be bound by and to perform, satisfy and discharge all of the obligations, liabilities and duties under the Deferment Agreement, as hereby amended, as if he/she were an original signatory to it. Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, the Spouse, together with the Owner, shall be liable for all taxes, interest, administration fees and charges that, at any time prior to the time at which this Amending Agreement takes effect, have been or may be deferred under the Deferment Agreement.

• This Amending Agreement shall be read together with the Deferment Agreement, and we confirm that, except as modified by this Amending Agreement, all covenants, terms and conditions in the Deferment Agreement shall remain unchanged, unmodified and in full force and effect.

• This Amending Agreement will take effect when a transfer, to the Spouse, of a portion of the interest of the Owner, ........................................[name of applicable owner], is registered in the land title office or given effect by the filing of a notice of transfer under the Manufactured Home Act.

• obtain the Parcel Identifier (PID) Number(s), registered owner information and legal description of the Property, or the details of the manufactured home that correspond with the Property and to endorse that information on this Amending Agreement with the intent that the endorsement will form part of this Amending Agreement, and, in the case of the manufactured home, endorse the information on the financing change statement;

• register this Amending Agreement as a modification to the registered charge created when the Deferment Agreement was registered in the land title office, or, in the case of a manufactured home, to register a financing change statement amending the financing statement registered at the Personal Property Registry when the Deferment Agreement was originally made.
